020package org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.internal;

022import static java.lang.String.join;
023import static java.util.Collections.unmodifiableMap;
024import static java.util.Locale.ROOT;
025import static java.util.stream.Collectors.toCollection;
026import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
027import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.SuppressableWarnings.JAVADOC;
028import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.SuppressableWarnings.createSuppressWarningsAnnotation;
029import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.internal.Util.NULL_REFERENCE;
030import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.internal.Util.stringLiteralWithDoubleQuotes;
031import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.EMPTY_STRING;
032import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.NULL_STRING;
033import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.checkState;
034import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
035import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
036import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
037import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireValidIntegerArgument;
038import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireValidNonNullArgument;
039import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.isEmpty;
040import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.isNotEmpty;

042import javax.lang.model.SourceVersion;
043import javax.lang.model.element.Modifier;
044import java.io.IOException;
045import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
046import java.util.ArrayList;
047import java.util.Collection;
048import java.util.EnumSet;
049import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
050import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
051import java.util.List;
052import java.util.Map;
053import java.util.Optional;
054import java.util.Set;
055
056import org.apiguardian.api.API;
057import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
058import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.UnsupportedEnumError;
059import org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.JavaComposer;
060import org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.Layout;
061import org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects;

063/**
064 *  Converts a
065 *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.JavaFile JavaFile}
066 *  to a string suitable to both human- and javac-consumption. This honours
067 *  imports, indentation, and deferred variable names.
068 *
069 *  @author Square,Inc.
070 *  @modified Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
071 *  @version $Id: CodeWriter.java 1063 2023-09-26 15:14:16Z tquadrat $
072 *  @since 0.0.5
073 *
074 *  @UMLGraph.link
075 */
076@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyFields", "ClassWithTooManyMethods", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
077@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: CodeWriter.java 1063 2023-09-26 15:14:16Z tquadrat $" )
078@API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
079public final class CodeWriter
080{
081        /*---------------*\
082    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
083        \*---------------*/
084    /**
085     *  The comment types.
086     *
087     *  @extauthor  Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
088     *  @version $Id: CodeWriter.java 1063 2023-09-26 15:14:16Z tquadrat $
089     *  @since 0.2.0
090     *
091     *  @UMLGraph.link
092     */
093    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: CodeWriter.java 1063 2023-09-26 15:14:16Z tquadrat $" )
094    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
095    private static enum CommentType
096    {
097            /*------------------*\
098        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
099            \*------------------*/
100        /**
101         *  No comment at all.
102         */
103        NO_COMMENT,
104
105        /**
106         *  A Javadoc comment.
107         */
108        JAVADOC_COMMENT,
109
110        /**
111         *  A block comment.
112         */
113        BLOCK_COMMENT,
114
115        /**
116         *  A line comment.
117         */
118        LINE_COMMENT
119    }
120    //  enum CommentType
121
122        /*-----------*\
123    ====** Constants **========================================================
124        \*-----------*/
125    /**
126     *  Sentinel value that indicates that no user-provided package has been
127     *  set.
128     */
129    @SuppressWarnings( "StringOperationCanBeSimplified" )
130    private static final String NO_PACKAGE = new String();
131
132        /*------------*\
133    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
134        \*------------*/
135    /**
136     *  The reference to the factory.
137     */
138    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
139    private final JavaComposer m_Composer;
140
141    /**
142     *  Flag that indicates that we are currently writing a normal comment.
143     */
144    private CommentType m_CurrentlyEmittingComment = CommentType.NO_COMMENT;
145
146    /**
147     *  The types that can be imported.
148     */
149    private final Map<String,ClassNameImpl> m_ImportableTypes = new LinkedHashMap<>();
150
151    /**
152     *  The imported types.
153     */
154    private final Map<String,ClassNameImpl> m_ImportedTypes;
155
156    /**
157     *  The indentation.
158     */
159    private final String m_Indent;
160
161    /**
162     *  The indentation level.
163     */
164    private int m_IndentLevel;
165
166    /**
167     *  The layout for the output.
168     */
169    private final Layout m_Layout;
170
171    /**
172     *  The output target.
173     */
174    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
175    private final LineWrapper m_LineWrapper;
176
177    /**
178     *  The current package name.
179     */
180    private String m_PackageName = NO_PACKAGE;
181
182    /**
183     *  The referenced names.
184     */
185    private final Collection<String> m_ReferencedNames = new LinkedHashSet<>();
186
187    /**
188     *  When a statement will be emitted, this is the line of the statement
189     *  currently being written. The first line of a statement is indented
190     *  normally and subsequent wrapped lines are double-indented. This is -1
191     *  when the currently-written line isn't part of a statement.
192     */
193    private int m_StatementLine = -1;
194
195    /**
196     *  The names of statically imported classes.
197     */
198    private final Set<String> m_StaticImportClassNames;
199
200    /**
201     *  The static imports.
202     */
203    private final Set<String> m_StaticImports;
204
205    /**
206     *  A flag that controls the trailing new line.
207     */
208    private boolean m_TrailingNewline;
209
210    /**
211     *  The types.
212     */
213    private final List<TypeSpecImpl> m_TypeSpecStack = new ArrayList<>();
214
215        /*--------------*\
216    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
217        \*--------------*/
218    /**
219     *  Creates a new {@code CodeWriter} instance.
220     *
221     *  @param  out The output target.
222     *
223     *  @deprecated Use
224     *      {@link #CodeWriter(JavaComposer, Appendable)}
225     *      instead.
226     */
227    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
228    public CodeWriter( final Appendable out ) { this( new JavaComposer(), out, Set.of() ); }
229
230    /**
231     *  Creates a new {@code CodeWriter} instance.
232     *
233     *  @param  out The output target.
234     *  @param  layout  The layout for the output.
235     *  @param  staticImports   The static imports.
236     *
237     *  @deprecated Use
238     *      {@link #CodeWriter(JavaComposer, Appendable)}
239     *      instead.
240     */
241    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
242    public CodeWriter( final Appendable out, final Layout layout, final Set<String> staticImports )
243    {
244        this( new JavaComposer( layout ), out, Map.of(), staticImports );
245    }   //  CodeWriter()
246
247    /**
248     *  Creates a new {@code CodeWriter} instance.
249     *
250     *  @param  out The output target.
251     *  @param  layout  The layout for the output.
252     *  @param  indent  The indentation; will be ignored.
253     *  @param  importedTypes   The imported types.
254     *  @param  staticImports   The static imports.
255     *
256     *  @deprecated Use
257     *      {@link #CodeWriter(JavaComposer, Appendable)}
258     *      instead.
259     */
260    @SuppressWarnings( "unused" )
261    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
262    public CodeWriter( final Appendable out, final Layout layout, final String indent, final Map<String,ClassNameImpl> importedTypes, final Set<String> staticImports )
263    {
264        this( new JavaComposer( layout ), out, importedTypes, staticImports );
265    }   //  CodeWriter()
266
267    /**
268     *  Creates a new {@code CodeWriter} instance.
269     *
270     *  @param  composer    The reference to the factory that created this
271     *      code writer instance.
272     *  @param  out The output target.
273     */
274    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
275    public CodeWriter( final JavaComposer composer, final Appendable out ) { this( composer, out, Set.of() ); }
276
277    /**
278     *  Creates a new {@code CodeWriter} instance.
279     *
280     *  @param  composer    The reference to the factory that created this
281     *      code writer instance.
282     *  @param  out The output target.
283     *  @param  staticImports   The static imports.
284     */
285    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
286    public CodeWriter( final JavaComposer composer, final Appendable out, final Set<String> staticImports )
287    {
288        this( composer, out, Map.of(), staticImports );
289    }   //  CodeWriter()
290
291    /**
292     *  Creates a new {@code CodeWriter} instance.
293     *
294     *  @param  composer    The reference to the factory that created this
295     *      code writer instance.
296     *  @param  out The output target.
297     *  @param  importedTypes   The imported types.
298     *  @param  staticImports   The static imports.
299     */
300    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
301    public CodeWriter( final JavaComposer composer, final Appendable out, final Map<String,ClassNameImpl> importedTypes, final Set<String> staticImports )
302    {
303        m_Composer = requireNonNullArgument( composer, "composer" );
304        m_Layout = m_Composer.getLayout();
305        m_Indent = m_Layout.indent();
306        m_LineWrapper = new LineWrapper( requireNonNullArgument( out, "out" ), m_Indent, 100 );
307        m_ImportedTypes = requireNonNullArgument( importedTypes, "importedTypes" );
308        m_StaticImports = requireNonNullArgument( staticImports, "staticImports" );
309        m_StaticImportClassNames = m_StaticImports.stream()
310            .map( s -> s.substring( 0, s.lastIndexOf( '.' ) ) )
311            .collect( toCollection( LinkedHashSet::new ) );
312    }   //  CodeWriter()
313
314        /*---------*\
315    ====** Methods **==========================================================
316        \*---------*/
317    /**
318     *  <p>{@summary Emits the given String to the output target.}</p>
319     *  <p>Delegates to
320     *  {@link #emitAndIndent(CharSequence)}.</p>
321     *
322     *  @param  input   The String.
323     *  @return This {@code CodeWriter} instance.
324     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the
325     *      output target.
326     */
327    public final CodeWriter emit( final CharSequence input ) throws UncheckedIOException { return emitAndIndent( input ); }
328
329    /**
330     *  Emits a
331     *  {@link CodeBlockImpl}
332     *  instance to the output target that is created on the fly from the given
333     *  arguments.
334     *
335     *  @param  format  The format.
336     *  @param  args    The arguments.
337     *  @return This {@code CodeWriter} instance.
338     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the
339     *      output target.
340     *
341     *  @see CodeBlockImpl#of(String, Object...)
342     */
343    public final CodeWriter emit( final String format, final Object... args ) throws UncheckedIOException
344    {
345        final var builder = new CodeBlockImpl.BuilderImpl( m_Composer );
346        builder.addWithoutDebugInfo( format, args );
347        emit( builder.build() );
348
349        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
350        return this;
351    }   //  emit()
352
353    /**
354     *  Emits the given
355     *  {@link CodeBlockImpl}
356     *  instance to the output target.
357     *
358     *  @param  codeBlock   The code block.
359     *  @return This {@code CodeWriter} instance.
360     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the
361     *      output target.
362     */
363    @SuppressWarnings( {"AssignmentToNull", "OverlyNestedMethod", "OverlyComplexMethod", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
364    public final CodeWriter emit( final CodeBlockImpl codeBlock ) throws UncheckedIOException
365    {
366        var argIndex = 0;
367        ClassNameImpl deferredTypeName = null; // used by "import static" logic
368        final var partIterator = requireNonNullArgument( codeBlock, "codeBlock" ).formatParts().listIterator();
369        while( partIterator.hasNext() )
370        {
371            final var part = partIterator.next();
372            //noinspection SwitchStatementWithTooManyBranches
373            switch( part )
374            {
375                case "$L" -> emitLiteral( codeBlock.args().get( argIndex++ ) );
376                case "$N" -> emitAndIndent( (CharSequence) codeBlock.args().get( argIndex++ ) );
377                case "$S" ->
378                {
379                    final var string = codeBlock.args().get( argIndex++ );
380
381                    //---* Emit null as a literal null: no quotes *------------
382                    emitAndIndent( string == NULL_REFERENCE ? "null" : stringLiteralWithDoubleQuotes( (String) string, m_Indent ) );
383                }
384
385                case "$T" ->
386                {
387                    final var typeName = (TypeNameImpl) codeBlock.args().get( argIndex++ );
388
389                    /*
390                     * Defer "typeName.emit(this)" if next format part will be
391                     * handled by the default case.
392                     */
393                    deferredTypeName = null;
394                    if( typeName instanceof final ClassNameImpl candidate && partIterator.hasNext() )
395                    {
396                        if( !codeBlock.formatParts().get( partIterator.nextIndex() ).startsWith( "$" ) )
397                        {
398                            if( m_StaticImportClassNames.contains( candidate.canonicalName() ) )
399                            {
400                                checkState( isNull( deferredTypeName ), () -> new IllegalStateException( "pending type for static import?!" ) );
401                                deferredTypeName = candidate;
402                            }
403                        }
404                    }
405                    if( isNull( deferredTypeName ) ) typeName.emit( this );
406                }
407
408                case "$$" -> emitAndIndent( "$" );
409                case "$>" -> indent();
410                case "$<" -> unindent();
411                case "$[" ->
412                {
413                    checkState( m_StatementLine == -1, () -> new IllegalStateException( "statement enter $[ followed by statement enter $[" ) );
414                    m_StatementLine = 0;
415                }
416
417                case "$]" ->
418                {
419                    checkState( m_StatementLine != -1, () -> new IllegalStateException( "statement exit $] has no matching statement enter $[" ) );
420                    if( m_StatementLine > 0 )
421                    {
422                        unindent( 2 ); // End a multi-line statement. Decrease
423                                       // the indentation level.
424                    }
425                    m_StatementLine = -1;
426                }
427
428                case "$W" ->
429                {
430                    try
431                    {
432                        m_LineWrapper.wrappingSpace( m_IndentLevel + 2 );
433                    }
434                    catch( final IOException e )
435                    {
436                        throw new UncheckedIOException( e );
437                    }
438                }
439
440                case "$Z" ->
441                {
442                    try
443                    {
444                        m_LineWrapper.zeroWidthSpace( m_IndentLevel + 2 );
445                    }
446                    catch( final IOException e )
447                    {
448                        throw new UncheckedIOException( e );
449                    }
450                }
451
452                default ->
453                {
454                    //---* Handle deferred type *------------------------------
455                    if( nonNull( deferredTypeName ) )
456                    {
457                        if( part.startsWith( "." ) )
458                        {
459                            if( emitStaticImportMember( deferredTypeName.canonicalName(), part ) )
460                            {
461                                /*
462                                 * Okay, static import hit and all was emitted,
463                                 * so clean-up and jump to next part.
464                                 */
465                                deferredTypeName = null;
466                                break;
467                            }
468                        }
469                        deferredTypeName.emit( this );
470                        deferredTypeName = null;
471                    }
472                    emitAndIndent( part );
473                }
474            }
475        }
476
477        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
478        return this;
479    }   //  emit()
480
481    /**
482     *  Emits the given String to the output target with indentation as
483     *  required. It's important that all code that writes to
484     *  {@link #m_LineWrapper}
485     *  does it through here, since we emit indentation lazily in order to
486     *  avoid unnecessary trailing whitespace.
487     *
488     *  @param  input   The String.
489     *  @return This {@code CodeWriter} instance.
490     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the
491     *      output target.
492     */
493    @SuppressWarnings( "OverlyComplexMethod" )
494    public final CodeWriter emitAndIndent( final CharSequence input ) throws UncheckedIOException
495    {
496        if( isNotEmpty( input ) )
497        {
498            var first = true;
499            LineLoop: for( final var line : input.toString().split( "\n", -1 ) )
500            {
501                /*
502                 * Emit a newline character. Make sure blank lines in Javadoc
503                 * and comments look good.
504                 */
505                if( !first )
506                {
507                    if( (m_CurrentlyEmittingComment != CommentType.NO_COMMENT) && m_TrailingNewline )
508                    {
509                        emitIndentation();
510                        try
511                        {
512                            m_LineWrapper.append( m_CurrentlyEmittingComment == CommentType.LINE_COMMENT ? "//" : " *" );
513                        }
514                        catch( final IOException e )
515                        {
516                            throw new UncheckedIOException( e );
517                        }
518                    }
519                    try
520                    {
521                        m_LineWrapper.append( "\n" );
522                    }
523                    catch( final IOException e )
524                    {
525                        throw new UncheckedIOException( e );
526                    }
527                    m_TrailingNewline = true;
528                    if( m_StatementLine != -1 )
529                    {
530                        if( m_StatementLine == 0 )
531                        {
532                            /*
533                             * Begin multiple-line statement. Increase the
534                             * indentation level.
535                             */
536                            indent( 2 );
537                        }
538                        ++m_StatementLine;
539                    }
540                }
541
542                first = false;
543                if( line.isEmpty() )
544                {
545                    //---* Don't indent empty lines *--------------------------
546                    continue LineLoop;
547                }
548
549                //---* Emit indentation and comment prefix if necessary *------
550                if( m_TrailingNewline )
551                {
552                    emitIndentation();
553                    try
554                    {
555                        switch( m_CurrentlyEmittingComment )
556                        {
557                            case BLOCK_COMMENT, JAVADOC_COMMENT -> m_LineWrapper.append( " * " );
558                            case LINE_COMMENT -> m_LineWrapper.append( "// " );
559                            case NO_COMMENT -> m_LineWrapper.append( EMPTY_STRING );
560                            default -> throw new UnsupportedEnumError( m_CurrentlyEmittingComment );
561                        }
562                    }
563                    catch( final IOException e )
564                    {
565                        throw new UncheckedIOException( e );
566                    }
567                }
568
569                try
570                {
571                    m_LineWrapper.append( line );
572                }
573                catch( final IOException e )
574                {
575                    throw new UncheckedIOException( e );
576                }
577                m_TrailingNewline = false;
578            }
579        }   //  LineLoop:
580
581        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
582        return this;
583    }   //  emitAndIndent()
584
585    /**
586     *  Emits the given annotations to the output target.
587     *
588     *  @param  annotations The annotations.
589     *  @param  inline  {@code true} if the annotations should be placed on the
590     *      same line as the annotated element, {@code false} otherwise.
591     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the
592     *      output target.
593     */
594    public final void emitAnnotations( final Iterable<AnnotationSpecImpl> annotations, final boolean inline ) throws UncheckedIOException
595    {
596        for( final var annotationSpec : annotations )
597        {
598            annotationSpec.emit( this, inline );
599            emit( inline ? " " : "\n" );
600        }
601    }   //  emitAnnotations()
602
603    /**
604     *  Emits the given
605     *  {@link CodeBlockImpl}
606     *  instance as a block comment to the output target.
607     *
608     *  @param  codeBlock   The code block with the comment.
609     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the
610     *      output target.
611     */
612    @SuppressWarnings( {"UseOfConcreteClass", "ThrowFromFinallyBlock"} )
613    public final void emitBlockComment( final CodeBlockImpl codeBlock ) throws UncheckedIOException
614    {
615        emit( "/*\n" );
616        m_TrailingNewline = true; // Force the ' *' prefix for the comment.
617        m_CurrentlyEmittingComment = CommentType.BLOCK_COMMENT;
618        try
619        {
620            emit( codeBlock );
621            emit( "\n" );
622        }
623        finally
624        {
625            m_CurrentlyEmittingComment = CommentType.NO_COMMENT;
626            emit( " */\n" );
627        }
628    }   //  emitBlockComment()
629
630    /**
631     *  Writes the indentation to the output target.
632     *
633     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the
634     *      output target.
635     */
636    private final void emitIndentation() throws UncheckedIOException
637    {
638        try
639        {
640            for( var i = 0; i < m_IndentLevel; ++i ) m_LineWrapper.append( m_Indent );
641        }
642        catch( final IOException e )
643        {
644            throw new UncheckedIOException( e );
645        }
646    }   //  emitIndentation()
647
648    /**
649     *  Emits the given
650     *  {@link CodeBlockImpl}
651     *  instance as a JavaDoc comment to the output target.
652     *
653     *  @param  codeBlock   The code block with the JavaDoc comment.
654     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the
655     *      output target.
656     */
657    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
658    public final void emitJavadoc( final CodeBlockImpl codeBlock ) throws UncheckedIOException
659    {
660        if( codeBlock.isEmpty() )
661        {
662            LayoutSwitch: switch( m_Layout )
663            {
664                case LAYOUT_DEFAULT:
665                case LAYOUT_JAVAPOET:
666                case LAYOUT_JAVAPOET_WITH_TAB: break;
667
668                case LAYOUT_FOUNDATION:
669                {
670                    emitAnnotations( List.of( (AnnotationSpecImpl) createSuppressWarningsAnnotation( m_Composer, JAVADOC ) ), false );
671                    break;
672                }
673
674                default: throw new UnsupportedEnumError( m_Layout );
675            }   //  LayoutSwitch:
676        }
677        else
678        {
679            emit( "/**\n" );
680            m_CurrentlyEmittingComment = CommentType.JAVADOC_COMMENT;
681            try
682            {
683                emit( codeBlock );
684            }
685            finally
686            {
687                m_CurrentlyEmittingComment = CommentType.NO_COMMENT;
688            }
689            emit( " */\n" );
690        }
691    }   //  emitJavadoc()
692
693    /**
694     *  Emits the given
695     *  {@link CodeBlockImpl}
696     *  instance as a line comment to the output target.
697     *
698     *  @param  codeBlock   The code block with the comment.
699     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the
700     *      output target.
701     */
702    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
703    public final void emitLineComment( final CodeBlockImpl codeBlock ) throws UncheckedIOException
704    {
705        m_TrailingNewline = true; // Force the '//' prefix for the comment.
706        m_CurrentlyEmittingComment = CommentType.LINE_COMMENT;
707        try
708        {
709            emit( codeBlock );
710            emit( "\n" );
711        }
712        finally
713        {
714            m_CurrentlyEmittingComment = CommentType.NO_COMMENT;
715        }
716    }   //  emitLineComment()
717
718    /**
719     *  Emits the given argument literally to the output target.
720     *
721     *  @param  o   The object to emit.
722     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the
723     *      output target.
724     */
725    @SuppressWarnings( {"IfStatementWithTooManyBranches", "ChainOfInstanceofChecks"} )
726    private final void emitLiteral( final Object o ) throws UncheckedIOException
727    {
728        if( o instanceof final TypeSpecImpl typeSpec )
729        {
730            typeSpec.emit( this, null, Set.of() );
731        }
732        else if( o instanceof final AnnotationSpecImpl annotationSpec )
733        {
734            annotationSpec.emit( this, true );
735        }
736        else if( o instanceof final CodeBlockImpl codeBlock )
737        {
738            emit( codeBlock );
739        }
740        else if( o == NULL_REFERENCE )
741        {
742            emitAndIndent( NULL_STRING );
743        }
744        else
745        {
746            emitAndIndent( String.valueOf( o ) );
747        }
748    }   //  emitLiteral()
749
750    /**
751     *  Emits {@code modifiers} to the output target in the standard order.
752     *  Modifiers in {@code implicitModifiers} will not be emitted.
753     *
754     *  @param  modifiers   The modifiers to emit.
755     *  @param  implicitModifiers   The modifiers to omit.
756     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the
757     *      output target.
758     */
759    public final void emitModifiers( final Collection<Modifier> modifiers, final Collection<Modifier> implicitModifiers ) throws UncheckedIOException
760    {
761        if( !modifiers.isEmpty() )
762        {
763            for( final var modifier : EnumSet.copyOf( modifiers ) )
764            {
765                if( !implicitModifiers.contains( modifier ) )
766                {
767                    emitAndIndent( modifier.name().toLowerCase( ROOT ) );
768                    emitAndIndent( " " );
769                }
770            }
771        }
772    }   //  emitModifiers()
773
774    /**
775     *  Emits {@code modifiers} to the output target in the standard order.
776     *
777     *  @param  modifiers   The modifiers to emit.
778     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the
779     *      output target.
780     */
781    public final void emitModifiers( final Collection<Modifier> modifiers ) throws UncheckedIOException
782    {
783        emitModifiers( modifiers, Set.of() );
784    }   //  emitModifiers()
785
786    /**
787     *  Emits a static import entry to the output target.
788     *
789     *  @param  canonical   The canonical name of the class to import.
790     *  @param  part    The part to emit.
791     *  @return {@code true} if something was emitted, {@code false} otherwise.
792     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the
793     *      output target.
794     */
795    @SuppressWarnings( "BooleanMethodNameMustStartWithQuestion" )
796    private final boolean emitStaticImportMember( final String canonical, final String part ) throws UncheckedIOException
797    {
798        final var partWithoutLeadingDot = requireNonNullArgument( part, "part" ).substring( 1 );
799
800        var retValue = !partWithoutLeadingDot.isEmpty();
801        if( retValue )
802        {
803            final var first = partWithoutLeadingDot.charAt( 0 );
804            //noinspection NestedAssignment
805            if( (retValue = Character.isJavaIdentifierStart( first )) == true )
806            {
807                final var explicit = canonical + "." + extractMemberName( partWithoutLeadingDot );
808                final var wildcard = canonical + ".*";
809                //noinspection NestedAssignment
810                if( (retValue = m_StaticImports.contains( explicit ) || m_StaticImports.contains( wildcard )) == true )
811                {
812                    emitAndIndent( partWithoutLeadingDot );
813                }
814            }
815        }
816
817        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
818        return retValue;
819    }   //  emitStaticImportMember()
820
821    /**
822     *  Emits type variables with their bounds. This should only be used when
823     *  declaring type variables; everywhere else bounds are omitted.
824     *
825     *  @param  typeVariables   The type variables.
826     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the output
827     *      target.
828     */
829    public final void emitTypeVariables( final List<TypeVariableNameImpl> typeVariables ) throws UncheckedIOException
830    {
831        if( !requireNonNullArgument( typeVariables, "typeVariables" ).isEmpty() )
832        {
833            emit( "<" );
834            var firstTypeVariable = true;
835            for( final var typeVariable : typeVariables )
836            {
837                if( !firstTypeVariable ) emit( ", " );
838                emitAnnotations( typeVariable.annotations(), true );
839                emit( "$L", typeVariable.name() );
840                var firstBound = true;
841                for( final var bound : typeVariable.bounds() )
842                {
843                    emit( firstBound ? " extends $T" : " & $T", bound );
844                    firstBound = false;
845                }
846                firstTypeVariable = false;
847            }
848            emit( ">" );
849        }
850    }   //  emitTypeVariables()
851
852    /**
853     *  Emits wrapping space to the output target.
854     *
855     *  @return This {@code CodeWriter} instance.
856     *  @throws UncheckedIOException A problem occurred when writing to the
857     *      output target.
858     */
859    public final CodeWriter emitWrappingSpace() throws UncheckedIOException
860    {
861        try
862        {
863            m_LineWrapper.wrappingSpace( m_IndentLevel + 2 );
864        }
865        catch( final IOException e )
866        {
867            throw new UncheckedIOException( e );
868        }
869
870        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
871        return this;
872    }   //  emitWrappingSpace()
873
874    /**
875     *  Extracts a member name from the given part.
876     *
877     *  @param  part    The part.
878     *  @return The member name, or if none could be found, the given part.
879     */
880    private static final String extractMemberName( final String part )
881    {
882        var retValue = requireValidNonNullArgument( part, "part", v -> Character.isJavaIdentifierStart( v.charAt( 0 ) ), $ -> "not an identifier: %s".formatted( part ) );
883        CheckLoop: for( var i = 1; i <= part.length(); ++i )
884        {
885            if( !SourceVersion.isIdentifier( part.substring( 0, i ) ) )
886            {
887                retValue = part.substring( 0, i - 1 );
888                break CheckLoop;
889            }
890        }   //  CheckLoop:
891
892        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
893        return retValue;
894    }   //  extractMemberName()
895
896    /**
897     *  Marks the given type as importable.
898     *
899     *  @param  className   The type.
900     */
901    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
902    private final void importableType( final ClassNameImpl className )
903    {
904        if( !requireNonNullArgument( className, "className" ).packageName().isEmpty() )
905        {
906            final var topLevelClassName = className.topLevelClassName();
907            final var simpleName = topLevelClassName.simpleName();
908            m_ImportableTypes.putIfAbsent( simpleName, topLevelClassName );
909        }
910    }   //  importableType
911
912    /**
913     *  Returns the imported types.
914     *
915     *  @return The imported types.
916     */
917    /*
918     * Originally, the return value was a reference to the internal field that
919     * allowed the modification of the Map.
920     */
921    public final Map<String,ClassNameImpl> importedTypes() { return unmodifiableMap( m_ImportedTypes ); }
922
923    /**
924     *  Increments the indentation level.
925     *
926     *  @return This {@code CodeWriter} instance.
927     */
928    public final CodeWriter indent() { return indent( 1 ); }
929
930    /**
931     *  Increases the indentation level by the given value.
932     *
933     *  @param  levels  The increase value.
934     *  @return This {@code CodeWriter} instance.
935     */
936    public final CodeWriter indent( final int levels )
937    {
938        m_IndentLevel += levels;
939
940        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
941        return this;
942    }   //  indent()
943
944    /**
945     *  Returns the layout for the output.
946     *
947     *  @return The layout.
948     */
949    public final Layout layout() { return m_Layout; }
950
951    /**
952     *  Returns the best name to identify {@code className} within the current
953     *  context. This uses the available imports and the current scope to find
954     *  the shortest name available. It does not honour names that are visible
955     *  due to inheritance.
956     *
957     *  @param  className   The name of the class.
958     *  @return The shortest possible name for the given class.
959     */
960    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
961    public final String lookupName( final ClassNameImpl className )
962    {
963        String retValue = null;
964        /*
965         * Find the shortest suffix of className that resolves to className.
966         * This uses both local type names (so `Entry` in 'Map' refers to
967         * 'Map.Entry'). Also uses imports.
968         */
969        var nameResolved = false;
970        for( var currentClassName = className; nonNull( currentClassName ) && isEmpty( retValue ); currentClassName = currentClassName.enclosingClassName().orElse( null ) )
971        {
972            final var resolved = resolve( currentClassName.simpleName() );
973            nameResolved = resolved.isPresent();
974
975            if( nameResolved && Objects.equals( resolved.get().canonicalName(), currentClassName.canonicalName() ) )
976            {
977                final var suffixOffset = currentClassName.simpleNames().size() - 1;
978                retValue = join( ".", className.simpleNames().subList( suffixOffset, className.simpleNames().size() ) );
979            }
980        }
981
982        if( isEmpty( retValue ) )
983        {
984            /*
985             * If the name resolved but wasn't a match, we're stuck with the
986             * fully qualified name.
987             */
988            if( nameResolved )
989            {
990                retValue = className.canonicalName();
991            }
992            else
993            //---* If the class is in the same package, we're done *-----------
994            {
995                if( Objects.equals( m_PackageName, className.packageName() ) )
996                {
997                    m_ReferencedNames.add( className.topLevelClassName().simpleName() );
998                    retValue = join( ".", className.simpleNames() );
999                }
1000                else
1001                {
1002                    /*
1003                     * We'll have to use the fully-qualified name. Mark the
1004                     * type as importable for a future pass.
1005                     */
1006                    if( m_CurrentlyEmittingComment != CommentType.JAVADOC_COMMENT ) importableType( className );
1007                    retValue = className.canonicalName();
1008                }
1009            }
1010        }
1011
1012        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1013        return retValue;
1014    }   //  lookupName()
1015
1016    /**
1017     *  Pops the package name.
1018     *
1019     *  @return This {@code CodeWriter} instance.
1020     */
1021    @SuppressWarnings( {"UnusedReturnValue", "StringEquality"} )
1022    public final CodeWriter popPackage()
1023    {
1024        checkState( m_PackageName != NO_PACKAGE, () -> new IllegalStateException( "package not set" ) );
1025        m_PackageName = NO_PACKAGE;
1026
1027        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1028        return this;
1029    }   //  popPackage()
1030
1031    /**
1032     *  Pops the top most type.
1033     *
1034     *  @return This {@code CodeWriter} instance.
1035     */
1036    @SuppressWarnings( "UnusedReturnValue" )
1037    public final CodeWriter popType()
1038    {
1039        m_TypeSpecStack.remove( m_TypeSpecStack.size() - 1 );
1040
1041        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1042        return this;
1043    }   //  popPackage()
1044
1045    /**
1046     *  Pushes the given package name.
1047     *
1048     *  @param  packageName The name of the package.
1049     *  @return This {@code CodeWriter} instance.
1050     */
1051    @SuppressWarnings( {"UnusedReturnValue", "StringEquality"} )
1052    public final CodeWriter pushPackage( final String packageName )
1053    {
1054        checkState( m_PackageName == NO_PACKAGE, () -> new IllegalStateException( "package already set: %s".formatted( m_PackageName ) ) );
1055        m_PackageName = requireNonNullArgument( packageName, "packageName" );
1056
1057        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1058        return this;
1059    }   //  pushPackage()
1060
1061    /**
1062     *  Pushes the give type.
1063     *
1064     *  @param  type    The type.
1065     *  @return This {@code CodeWriter} instance.
1066     */
1067    @SuppressWarnings( "UnusedReturnValue" )
1068    public final CodeWriter pushType( final TypeSpecImpl type )
1069    {
1070        m_TypeSpecStack.add( type );
1071
1072        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1073        return this;
1074    }   //  pushType()
1075
1076    /**
1077     *  Returns the class referenced by {@code simpleName}, using the current
1078     *  nesting context and imports.
1079     *
1080     *  @param  simpleName  The name of the class we search for.
1081     *  @return An instance of
1082     *      {@link Optional}
1083     *      that holds the {@code ClassName} instance for the resolved class.
1084     */
1085    // TODO(jwilson): also honour superclass members when resolving names.
1086    @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalGetWithoutIsPresent" )
1087    private final Optional<ClassNameImpl> resolve( final String simpleName )
1088    {
1089        Optional<ClassNameImpl> retValue = Optional.empty();
1090
1091        //---* Match a child of the current (potentially nested) class *-------
1092        for( var i = m_TypeSpecStack.size() - 1; (i >= 0) && retValue.isEmpty(); --i )
1093        {
1094            final var typeSpec = m_TypeSpecStack.get( i );
1095            for( final var visibleChild : typeSpec.typeSpecs() )
1096            {
1097                if( Objects.equals( visibleChild.name().get(), simpleName ) )
1098                {
1099                    retValue = Optional.of( stackClassName( i, simpleName ) );
1100                }
1101            }
1102        }
1103
1104        if( retValue.isEmpty() )
1105        {
1106            //---* Match the top-level class *---------------------------------
1107            if( (!m_TypeSpecStack.isEmpty()) && Objects.equals( m_TypeSpecStack.get( 0 ).name(), simpleName ) )
1108            {
1109                retValue = Optional.of( ClassNameImpl.from( m_PackageName, simpleName ) );
1110            }
1111            else
1112            {
1113                //---* Match an imported type *--------------------------------
1114                final var importedType = m_ImportedTypes.get( simpleName );
1115                retValue = Optional.ofNullable( importedType );
1116            }
1117        }
1118
1119        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1120        return retValue;
1121    }   //  resolve()
1122
1123    /**
1124     *  Returns the class named {@code simpleName} when nested in the class at
1125     *  {@code stackDepth}.
1126     *
1127     *  @param  simpleName  The class name.
1128     *  @param  stackDepth  The search depth.
1129     *  @return The found class.
1130     */
1131    @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalGetWithoutIsPresent" )
1132    private final ClassNameImpl stackClassName( final int stackDepth, final String simpleName )
1133    {
1134        /*
1135         * The type spec stack may not contain anonymous types, so no check for
1136         * the name is required.
1137         */
1138        @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalGetWithoutIsPresent" )
1139        var className = ClassNameImpl.from( m_PackageName, m_TypeSpecStack.get( 0 ).name().get() );
1140        for( var i = 1; i <= stackDepth; ++i )
1141        {
1142            className = className.nestedClass( m_TypeSpecStack.get( i ).name().get() );
1143        }
1144        final var retValue = className.nestedClass( simpleName );
1145
1146        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1147        return retValue;
1148    }   //  stackClassName()
1149
1150    /**
1151     *  <p>{@summary Returns the current statement line.}</p>
1152     *  <p>When a statement will be emitted, this method returns the line of
1153     *  the statement currently being written. The first line of a statement is
1154     *  indented normally and subsequent wrapped lines are double-indented.
1155     *  This is -1 when the currently-written line isn't part of a
1156     *  statement.</p>
1157     *
1158     *  @return The statement line, or -1.
1159     */
1160    public final int statementLine() { return m_StatementLine; }
1161
1162    /**
1163     *  Sets the current statement line.
1164     *
1165     *  @param  statementLine   The new value for the current statement line.
1166     *
1167     *  @see #statementLine()
1168     */
1169    public final void statementLine( final int statementLine ) { m_StatementLine = statementLine; }
1170
1171    /**
1172     *  Returns the types that should have been imported for this code. If
1173     *  there were any simple name collisions, that type's first use is
1174     *  imported.
1175     *
1176     *  @return The types that should have been imported.
1177     */
1178    public final Map<String,ClassNameImpl> suggestedImports()
1179    {
1180        final Map<String,ClassNameImpl> retValue = new LinkedHashMap<>( m_ImportableTypes );
1181        retValue.keySet().removeAll( m_ReferencedNames );
1182
1183        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1184        return retValue;
1185    }   //  suggestedImports()
1186
1187    /**
1188     *  Decrements the indentation level.
1189     *
1190     *  @return This {@code CodeWriter} instance.
1191     */
1192    public final CodeWriter unindent() { return unindent( 1 ); }
1193
1194    /**
1195     *  Decreases the indentation level by the given value.
1196     *
1197     *  @param  levels  The decrease value.
1198     *  @return This {@code CodeWriter} instance.
1199     */
1200    public final CodeWriter unindent( final int levels )
1201    {
1202        m_IndentLevel -= requireValidIntegerArgument( levels, "levels", v -> m_IndentLevel - levels >= 0, $ -> "cannot unindent %d from %d".formatted( levels, m_IndentLevel ) );
1203
1204        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1205        return this;
1206    }   //  unindent()
1207}
1208//  class CodeWriter
